p: Dengue fever, caused by 4 viral serotypes (DENV 1–4), is the most prevalent mosquito-borne viral infection in tropical and subtropical countries, including the southwest of the Indian Ocean region [ 2]. An epidemic of DENV-2 is currently taking place in the French overseas region Reunion Island. ZIKV causes important outbreaks in the South Pacific, Americas and South-East Asia. The recent ZIKV epidemics in French Polynesia and South America were associated with severe fetal brain injury and neurological defects in adults such as the Guillain-Barré syndrome [ 8, 9, 10, 11]. ZIKV infection is now identified as a sexually transmitted illness as well [ 12, 13]. Phylogenetic studies allowed the division of ZIKV into African and Asian lineages [ 14]. Since 2007, the leading cause of major epidemics is the ZIKV Asian genotype [ 15].
